issue.title: Underspecified use of locale facets for locale-dependent std::format

discussion.p: There are std::format variants that take an explicit std::locale parameter. There is the "L" format specifier that uses that locale (or some environment locale) for formatting, according to p17:

blockquote.p: "For integral types, the locale-specific form causes the context's locale to be used to insert the appropriate digit group separator characters."

discussion.p: It is unclear which specific facets are used to make this happen. This is important, because users can install their own facets into a given locale. Specific questions include:

li.p: Is num_put<> being used? Or just numpunct<>?
Are any of the _byname facets being used?

discussion.p: Assuming the encoding for char is UTF-8, the use of a user-provided num_put<> facet (as opposed to std::format creating the output based on numpunct<>) would allow digit separators that are not expressibly as a single UTF-8 code unit.
